DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Study Agent Sponsor Organization Identifier Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to idicate the name of the sponsoring organization providing the study agent or drug for use on a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Study Agent Sponsor Organization Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the name or identifier of the institution manufacturing or providing a medication or drug designed to produce a specific effect used on a clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.  Such studies test new methods of screening, prevention, diagnosis, or treatment of a disease.  The study may be carried out in a clinic or other medical facility.  Also called a clinical trial.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI):A person or organization that supports or champions something.:A formal group of people with one or more shared goals.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
A person or organization that supports or champions something.
A formal group of people that exists to further a particular profession.

Property.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to indicate the name of the sponsor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Personal names, given or surname, as cultural characteristics, as ethnological or religious patterns, as indications of the geographic distribution of families and inbreeding, etc. Analysis of isonymy, the quality of having the same or similar names, is useful in the study of population genetics. NAMES is used also for the history of names or name changes of corporate bodies, such as medical societies, universities, hospitals, government agencies, etc.

Concepts.definition: A word or group of words indicating the identity of a person usually consisting of a first (personal) name and a last (family) name with an optional middle name. In some cultural traditions the family name comes first.
